description: User authentication with JWT tokens - ATDD/TDD example
acceptanceCriteria: Given a new user with valid email and password, when they register, then an account is created and they receive a confirmation
Given a registered user with correct credentials, when they login, then they receive a valid JWT token
Given a registered user with incorrect password, when they login, then authentication fails with appropriate error
Given a user with a valid JWT token, when they access protected resources, then access is granted
Given a user with an expired JWT token, when they access protected resources, then access is denied and token refresh is required
Given a JWT token, when validated, then user identity and permissions are correctly extracted
notes: This example demonstrates ATDD/TDD for a common authentication feature
Acceptance criteria defined in Given-When-Then format
TDD will build up the implementation iteratively
Integration tests will verify database and token operations
